column4: How do I reinstall the open drivers? i think something is corrupted in them? seriously need some help here
what drivers, can you be more specific
no idea >_< im having problems with programs trying tp use opengl i get 'segmentation fault' my graphics card is and ATI mobility radeon 9000

can u help me out? i told you what my problems are and what im running... ATI mobility radeon 9000. Programs that require OpenGl (i think) crash out before even really loading anything and I get 'Segmentation fault'. I'm running Ubuntu 9.10
it has been since I have used old ATI gear and the 3d drivers (I have one machine that I use the 2d only drivers)
under System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers, do you have the ati or fglrx drivers installed?
i opened that up it says no proprietary drivers are in use on this system
then you will need to install the fglrx drivers to get 3d (open gl) apps to work
how do i do that? Ive been asking that all day and no one will answer
sudo aptitude install xorg-driver-fglrx fglrx-amdcccle
still nothing runs
glxinfo
http://pastebin.com/m11b9f932
that is way less output than I would expect.  IS the module loaded?  "lsmod |grep fglrx"
I put in lsmod |grep fglrx but it doesnt have any output, should it have?
try "sudo modprobe fglrx"
http://pastebin.com/d1ce93768
ya I saw that, that is a new error to me.  You may wish to try rebooting.
I am not really confidant that it will solve anything
do you have a program called aticonfig installed?
i typed aticonfig into the terminal and got this: aticonfig: No supported adapters detected
aticonfig: No supported adapters detected
